thread.title: Greenback’s run game stops Coalfield, 14-2
thread.title_full: Greenback’s run game stops Coalfield, 14-2 - PrepXtra Story

author: Bill Howard
title: Greenback’s run game stops Coalfield, 14-2
text:
COALFIELD — Greenback High School outlasted Coalfield 14-2 in a lightning-delayed, error-prone game at Harlan Walls Stadium Friday night.
The Cherokees (5-2, 3-0 Region 2 1-A) relied on a gritty ground game with 173 yards on 32 carries to score on the first possession of each half.
“Any time you win you’re pleased,” said Cherokees interim coach Brent Kilpatrick. “I don’t think we played our best football. Coalfield can probably say the same thing. It was kind of a weird start when you’re delayed like that.”
Greenback’s first score came with 3:31 left in the first quarter. Taking over on their own 36-yard line, quarterback Hunter Willis hit Kayne Roberts for a 22-yard touchdown, finishing off an eight-play, 64-yard drive.
The PAT was botched, and the 6-0 score held up to intermission.
Things in the first half might well have been much worse for Coalfield (6-2, 2-2).
In addition to a fourth down miss, the Yellow Jackets lost a fumble on a handoff exchange with 6:16 left in the second period.
Then, with 1:38 left in the half, a Greenback punt grazed off the foot of Coalfield’s John Ervin and was recovered by the Cherokees’ Tylor Jones on Coalfield’s 39.
Neither time, however, did the Cherokees capitalize.
Greenback made it 14-0 on the opening drive of second half when Devin Divine went left for a 21-yard touchdown run.
Another turnover by Coalfield — a fumble on the first play of the ensuing drive — might have led to a knockout punch by Greenback. But Willis’ fourth-down pass on the ensuing drive was intercepted by Tyler Keathley.
Coalfield scored early in the fourth when Roberts was tackled in the end zone for a safety. But yet another fumble foiled its next possession.
The Jackets lost four of their six fumbles.
“We were happy to be as physical as we were,” Kilpatrick said. “We came out and played good defense and stayed focused. Greenback-Coalfield is a notoriously physical game and both came to play tonight.”
Bill Howard is a freelance contributor.
Greenback 14, Coalfield 2
Greenback 6 0 8 0 — 14
Coalfield 0 0 0 2 — 2
Scoring: G — Kayne Roberts 22 pass from Hunter Willis (kick failed); Devin Devine 1 run (Roberts pass from Willis); C — Roberts tackled in the end zone
Records: Greenback 5-2, 3-0 Region 2-A, Coalfield 6-2, 2-2
